# The `LinkGraphLinkingLayer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer">LinkGraphLinkingLayer</a> links LinkGraphs into the Executor using JITLink. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer">LinkGraphLinkingLayer</a> links LinkGraphs into the Executor using JITLink.

Clients can use this class to add LinkGraphs to an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executionsession">ExecutionSession</a>, and it serves as a base for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/objectlinkinglayer">ObjectLinkingLayer</a> that can link object files.

Definition at line 43 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

### LinkGraphLinkingLayer() {#a0960a18b5222ff8dfaa402b42dbb1011}

<MemberDefinition

Takes ownership of the given JITLinkMemoryManager. This method is a temporary hack to simplify co-existence with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer</a> (which also owns its allocators).

### removePlugin() {#a4bc37c4c8cfaf6346924ed90e7df38c4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::LinkGraphLinkingLayer::removePlugin (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer/plugin">Plugin</a> &amp; P)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Remove a plugin.

This remove applies only to subsequent links (links already underway will continue to use the plugin), and does not of itself destroy the plugin – destruction will happen once all shared pointers (including those held by in-progress links) are destroyed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h/#l00103">103</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setAutoClaimResponsibilityForObjectSymbols() {#a42ee09093baf2b4dbb6fcabd6e869442}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LinkGraphLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::LinkGraphLinkingLayer::setAutoClaimResponsibilityForObjectSymbols (bool AutoClaimObjectSymbols)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If set, this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer">LinkGraphLinkingLayer</a> instance will claim responsibility for any symbols provided by a given object file that were not already in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance.

Setting this flag allows higher-level program representations (e.g. LLVM IR) to be added based on only a subset of the symbols they provide, without having to write intervening layers to scan and add the additional symbols. This trades diagnostic quality for convenience however: If all symbols are enumerated up-front then clashes can be detected and reported early (and usually deterministically). If this option is set, clashes for the additional symbols may not be detected until late, and detection may depend on the flow of control through JIT&#39;d code. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> with care.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h/#l00142">142</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setOverrideObjectFlagsWithResponsibilityFlags() {#a749aed4686716faf9e149640e2e4071d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LinkGraphLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::LinkGraphLinkingLayer::setOverrideObjectFlagsWithResponsibilityFlags (bool OverrideObjectFlags)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Instructs this LinkgraphLinkingLayer instance to override the symbol flags found in the LinkGraph with the flags supplied by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance.

This is a workaround to support symbol visibility in <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a>, which does not use the libObject&#39;s SF&#95;Exported flag. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> only when generating / adding <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a> object files.

FIXME: We should be able to remove this if/when <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a> properly tracks exported symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h/#l00125">125</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

ResourceManagers should perform book-keeping under the session lock, and any expensive cleanup outside the session lock.

### handleTransferResources() {#aea1af7eb172233957b31e31f86f8fcef}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::LinkGraphLinkingLayer::handleTransferResources (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> &amp; JD, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a48eb648e96394270c69273c29bfad24e">ResourceKey</a> DstK, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a48eb648e96394270c69273c29bfad24e">ResourceKey</a> SrcK)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function will be called <em>inside</em> the session lock.

ResourceManagers DO NOT need to re-lock the session.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h/#l00164">164</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-h">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-cpp/#l00565">565</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/linkgraphlinkinglayer-cpp">LinkGraphLinkingLayer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
